result.markdown:
--- title: "Power Analysis Cannabis" --- ## Prerequisites Conduct an analysis to determine the power of the study to detect a significant effect of the `treatment` and `setup` on the outcome. The study is a repeated measures design between `n=10` and `n=2500` persons. The repeated measures are `rep_measures=10` per person. The alpha significance level is set to $\alpha = 0.05$. For each sample size, we conduct `sims=100` simulations. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} possible_pers <- c(10, seq(from=50, to=1e3, by=50), 1250, 1500, 2e3, 2.5e3, 3e3) rep_measures <- 10 alpha <- 0.01 sims <- 200 ``` ::: ## Simulate Data We simulate the data for each sample size and store the results in a list of matrices. - $x_{age} \sim Unif(18, 65)$ - $x_{education} \sim \mathcal{U}\{"High\_School", "Some\_College", "Other\_College"\}$ - $x_{gender} \sim \mathcal{U}\{"male", "female"\}$ - $x_{treatment} \sim \mathcal{U}\{0, 1\}$ and the mixed effects: $\gamma_j \sim N(\mu_j, 0.5)$ where the person effect $\mu_j,\ j \in 1, \ldots, 10$ are in the interval $[-3, 3]$. We conduct power analysis for an alpha level of 0.05, a treatment effect of 0.5 and setup effects compared to "Cannabis" of -1, 1.5, 2.5, 3.5. We try to reflect a reasonable reasonable transition by the intercepts of c(1.7, 1.5, 0.5, 0, -0.8, -1, -1.5)\` where 1 --\> 2 from "Kein Strafbedürfnis" --\> "monatliches Nettogehalt" 2 --\> 3 from "monatliches Nettogehalt" --\> "2x monatliches Nettogehalt" 3 --\> 4 from "2x monatliches Nettogehalt" --\> "3x monatliches Nettogehalt" 4 --\> 5 from "3x monatliches Nettogehalt" --\> "Freiheitsstrafe bis 2 Jahre mit Bewährung" 5 --\> 6 from "Freiheitsstrafe bis 2 Jahre mit Bewährung" --\> "Freiheitsstrafe bis 2 Jahre ohne Bewährung" 6 --\> 7 from "Freiheitsstrafe bis 2 Jahre ohne Bewährung" --\> "Freiheitsstrafe 2 - 5 Jahre" 7 --\> 8 from "Freiheitsstrafe 2 - 5 Jahre" --\> "Freiheitsstrafe über 5 Jahre" From the data we generate Y as a mixed ordinal outcome with 8 categories and model the data with a mixed ordinal model using the `clm` function from the `ordinal` package. The linear predictor is given by the formula $Y \sim age + treatment \times setup$. TODO: Try without person effect and covariate control ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} beta = c("age" = 0.05, "educationHS" = -0.1, "educationSC" = -0.05, "educationOC" = 0.03, "gender" = -0.5, "treatmentMany" = 1.5, "setupAlcohol" = -0.5, "setupStealth" = 0.2, "setupCocain" = 2.5, "setupRobbery" = 3, "treatment:setupAlcohol" = -0.4, "treatment:setupStealth" = 0.4, "treatment:setupCocain" = 1.5, "treatment:setupRobbery" = 1) intercepts <- c(-1, -3.5, -6, -7, -7.5, -7.75, -8) p_eff = seq(-3, 3, length.out = 100) sim_data = simulate_mixed_ordinal(100, beta, intercepts, p_eff) kableExtra::kable(head(sim_data)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
age education gender treatment setup p_id Y
32 High_School male 0 Canabis 1 Kein Strafbedürfnis
32 High_School male 1 Canabis 1 monatliches Nettogehalt
32 High_School male 0 Alcohol 1 Kein Strafbedürfnis
32 High_School male 1 Alcohol 1 Kein Strafbedürfnis
32 High_School male 0 Stealth 1 Kein Strafbedürfnis
32 High_School male 1 Stealth 1 monatliches Nettogehalt
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} summary(sim_data) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` age education gender treatment setup Min. :18.00 High_School :260 male :590 Min. :0.0 Canabis:200 1st Qu.:29.75 Some_College :390 female:410 1st Qu.:0.0 Alcohol:200 Median :40.00 Other_College:350 Median :0.5 Stealth:200 Mean :41.41 Mean :0.5 Cocain :200 3rd Qu.:53.25 3rd Qu.:1.0 Robbery:200 Max. :65.00 Max. :1.0 p_id Y Min. : 1.00 monatliches Nettogehalt :316 1st Qu.: 25.75 2x monatliches Nettogehalt :296 Median : 50.50 Kein Strafbedürfnis :150 Mean : 50.50 Freiheitsstrafe über 5 Jahre :108 3rd Qu.: 75.25 3x monatliches Nettogehalt : 81 Max. :100.00 Freiheitsstrafe bis 2 Jahre mit Bewährung: 28 (Other) : 21 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} power_exp = lapply(possible_pers, function(pers) { p_eff = seq(-3,3, length.out = pers) exp = lapply(1:sims, function(sim) { sim_data = simulate_mixed_ordinal(pers, beta, intercepts, p_eff) model.fit = clm(Y ~ treatment * setup + age + education, data = sim_data, link = "logit") summary(model.fit)$coefficients # Extract p-values }) message(Sys.time(), paste(" Finished", pers, "persons")) saveRDS(exp, paste0("powerexp_", pers, ".rds")) }) ``` ::: ## Power Analysis Covariate adjusted power analysis by simulation for the ordinal model. ::: {.cell inlcude='false'} ```{.r .cell-code} effects = c("treatment", "setupAlcohol", "setupStealth", "setupCocain", "setupRobbery", "treatment:setupAlcohol", "treatment:setupStealth", "treatment:setupCocain", "treatment:setupRobbery") power_analysis = lapply(effects, function(covar) { pwr = unlist(lapply(power_exp, function(exp) { p_values = sapply(exp, function(x) x[covar, "Pr(>|z|)"], simplify = "vector") power = mean(sapply(p_values, function(x) x < alpha)) })) cbind.data.frame(power = pwr, persons = possible_pers, effect = covar) }) power_analysis = rbindlist(power_analysis) effects[1] = "treatmentMany" ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](pwr_analysis_files/figure-html/plot_power-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Tables with effect, effect size and power for each sample size. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
effect power persons log_odds odds
setupRobbery 1.000 50 3.0 20.0855369
setupCocain 1.000 50 2.5 12.1824940
treatment 0.840 50 1.5 4.4816891
treatment:setupCocain 0.825 100 1.5 4.4816891
treatment:setupRobbery 0.825 200 1.0 2.7182818
setupAlcohol 0.840 450 -0.5 0.6065307
treatment:setupStealth 0.820 1250 0.4 1.4918247
treatment:setupAlcohol 0.835 1500 -0.4 0.6703200
setupStealth 0.905 3000 0.2 1.2214028
````` ::: ::: Estimating sample size needed by using the pwrss package and a logistic regression: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} log_odds <- pwer_sample$log_odds p1 <- exp(log_odds)/(1 + exp(log_odds)) df_probs <- data.frame(effect = pwer_sample$effect, prob = p1) p0 <- seq(0.2, 0.8, 0.1) df_results <- data.frame(effect = numeric(0), p0 = numeric(0), p1 = numeric(0), sample_size = numeric(0)) for (j in seq(length(p0))) { for (i in seq(length(p1))) { sample_size <- pwrss.z.logreg(p0 = p0[j], p1 = p1[i], alpha = 0.05, power = 0.8, r2.other.x = 0.5)$n result_row <- data.frame(effect = pwer_sample$effect[i], p0 = p0[j], p1 = p1[i], sample_size = as.integer(sample_size)) df_results <- rbind(df_results, result_row) } } ``` ::: Sample sizes needed according to pwrss for a power of 0.8. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
